title: 820-00850-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
message:
Hi Guys, good evening. I got from a customer a A1989 EMC 3214, board 820-00850-A  and it suffered medium liquid damage, in my opinion. I replaced some caps and res, some other ones I just reflux and it's turning on now. The problem is it doesn't load the OSX until the end, even from Internal or External drives. 

The major problem I have now is, the [B]R4802 [/B]lost its point 2, and looks like it's a point that sends energy to a lot of other points over the board. There's a whole in its place and I don't know how to solve this.

I run Apple diagnosis and no-fault was mentioned. The battery is still working good.

Any ideas?

Thanks, Eduardo

title: 820-00850-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

I cannot find R4802 on the schematic...

title: 820-00850-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 71640, member: 682"]
First of all, welcome to the forum!

I cannot find R4802 on the schematic...
[/QUOTE]
Second craziest thing : I can locate it on the Boardview but not in the schematic. First time I see something so crazy...

title: 820-00850-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
message:
Oops, that's true.
I cannot find U4801 too.

As I saw in boardview, R4802 is part of PPBUS_HS_CPU sensor.
Not too many connections as you've mentioned.
Try starting in SMC bypass mode.

title: 820-00850-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 71650, member: 682"]

title: 820-00850-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
message:
We cannot get all schematics and boardviews from Apple.
There are several revisions and we are lucky if get one.

title: 820-00850-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
message: Every one I found is the same revision.  Please, if you find something different, let me know. I really appreciate your help

title: 820-00850-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
message:
Did you try to start in SMC bypass mode?
Just to see if loads OSX.
You can also try safe mode.

title: 820-00850-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
message:
U4800/U4801 circuit can be found on 820-01700 schematics. It seems like it can throttle hard the CPU/GPU if it detects a voltage drop on PPBUS_G3H (below 7.5V I think).
R4802/R4800 is just a voltage divider from PPBUS_G3H to PBUS_DIVIDER (pin 1 of U4801) so that should be easily repairable.

title: 820-00850-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 71658, member: 682"]
Did you try to start in SMC bypass mode?
Just to see if loads OSX.
You can also try safe mode.
[/QUOTE]

I've made the SMC Bypass and the computer loaded the previous User login screen. when I put the login password to proceed, the computer restarts and it's like an ever ending cycle again...
Looks like there's something messed on the T2...

Thoughts?

Thanks again

title: 820-00850-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
message:
Try DFU mode.
Be aware, Restore option will erase entire SSD.
Better to choose Revive first, if you need the data.

title: 820-00850-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
message:
Hi guys... The customer didn't care about the data, so I went to restore mode on the DFU mode... It appears to complete the process. The point is that, when I boot the computer holding option to choose and external drive, I can see my USB drive and, as I click on it to proceed, at same time it goes to the Internet Recovery... It won't be a problem if, when I chose my wifi network, and goes to the password screen to enter it, the mouse starts stepping and it never finishes the connection and do not proceed... 

I tried to start from Catalina and BigSur drives I have here. 

BTW, I don't fix the issue on the R4802 yet... I don't have another resistor with same specs to put there. 

Thanks guys. 

Thoughts?

title: 820-00850-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
message: You must fix that problem first, as an SMC sensor can block the system.

title: 820-00850-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
message:
I'm back to work on this board... I stated that the R4802 lost its point 2 [B]BUT[/B] [B]it lost[/B] [B]point 1 (PPBUS_HS_CPU)[/B]. That's why I told you, it had a lot of other points on the board. I run a wire from this pin 1 to the other side of the board and the Internet recovery is now working and the computer is back to life.

Thanks for the help and you can close the thread.
